intro: Plananthus squarrosus, commonly known as the squarrose plananthus, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
